support_summary: PRKN (Parkin) physically binds ATXN3 via its Ubl and Josephin domains (Co-IP evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Selective autophagic clearance of damaged mitochondria via the PINK1/Parkin pathway.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 deubiquitinates Parkin and its mitochondrial substrate VDAC1. Mutant ATXN3 removes ubiquitin from VDAC1 more efficiently, preventing the recruitment of autophagy receptors and thus inhibiting mitophagy.
biological_consequence: Mitochondrial depolarization -> PINK1 recruits Parkin -> Parkin ubiquitylates VDAC1 -> ATXN3 (especially mutant) deubiquitinates VDAC1 -> Prevents autophagosome recruitment -> Impairs mitophagy and leads to mitochondrial dysfunction.
specific_effects: Deubiquitination of K27- and K29-linked chains on Parkin
Enhanced autophagic degradation of Parkin by mutant ATXN3
Removal of ubiquitin from VDAC1, blocking mitochondrial clearance

evidence.paper_title: The Machado-Joseph disease-associated mutant form of ataxin-3 regulates parkin ubiquitination and stability
evidence.relevant_quote: Expanded ataxin-3 promoted rather than prevented the degradation of parkin... increased parkin turnover involved autophagy.

mechanism_correction: ATXN3 deubiquitinates Parkin, but the effect is context-dependent. While it regulates Parkin stability by removing K27/K29-linked chains, mutant ATXN3 actually DESTABILIZES Parkin by promoting its autophagic clearance. Furthermore, mutant ATXN3 deubiquitinates VDAC1, which INHIBITS (rather than promotes) Parkin-mediated mitophagy.
mechanism: Selective autophagic clearance of damaged mitochondria via the PINK1/Parkin pathway.
effect: ATXN3 deubiquitinates Parkin and its mitochondrial substrate VDAC1. Mutant ATXN3 removes ubiquitin from VDAC1 more efficiently, preventing the recruitment of autophagy receptors and thus inhibiting mitophagy.
summary: ATXN3 inhibits PRKN to modulate mitophagy regulation.

evidence.paper_title: The Machado-Joseph disease-associated mutant form of ataxin-3 regulates parkin ubiquitination and stability
evidence.relevant_quote: Expanded ataxin-3 promoted rather than prevented the degradation of parkin... increased parkin turnover involved autophagy.

evidence.paper_title: Ataxin-3 and the fight between mitochondrial recycling and cell death
evidence.journal: National Ataxia Foundation (summarizing Durcan et al.)
evidence.relevant_quote: Mutant ataxin-3 was removing these ubiquitin tags from the VDAC1 protein... Deubiquitination means that these sick or damaged mitochondria aren't being broken down.

initial_pathway.reasoning: Ataxin-3 interacts with Parkin (PRKN) to regulate its stability and activity in the clearance of damaged mitochondria.
